lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 11, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 11** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

3. After that, locate the `src/main/java/duke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run duke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:
* Main class contains the storage, ui, tasklist, parser and finder objects,
DukeException newException = new DukeException("Please input a number!");
throw new DukeException("I'm sorry, but I don't know what that means :-(");
ui.PrintMessage("Bye. Hope to see you again soon!");
* Encapsulates a task with a deadline.
* Similar to a task, a task with a deadline has a description,
* but also contains the deadline for the task.
* Constructor for creating a deadline task
* @param description The description of the deadline task.
* @param by The deadline of the task.
* Returns string representation of Deadline task.
* Method override from toString() of parent class Task.
super.toString(), month, date, year, hour, minute);
* Marks task as done, and returns string representation of deadline task being marked done.
* Method override from markDone() of parent class Task.
* @return string representation of deadline task being marked done.
return String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  [D][X] %s", this.description);
* Encapsulates a task that is an event.
* Similar to a task, an event has a description,
* but also contains the date/time for the event.
* @param description The description of the event.
* @param at The date/time of the event.
* Returns event time of Event task.
* Returns string representation of Event task.
* Method override from toString() of parent class Task.
super.toString(), month, date, year, hour, minute);
* Marks task as done, and returns string representation of event task being marked done.
* Method override from markDone() of parent class Task.
* @return string representation of event task being marked done.
return String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  [E][X] %s", this.description);
* This class handles the searching of tasks based on user's input.
* Checks if description of task contains input string.
* @param description The description of a task to be checked against.
public boolean isMatch(String input, String description) {
* Returns a list of tasks with descriptions that matches the input string.
* @param input The input string to be checked for matches with.
* @param taskList The taskList to check against.
* @return The new taskList with the matched tasks.
public TaskList findMatch(String input, TaskList taskList) {
* A task contains the description of itself,
* a boolean of whether task is completed,
* and also the logo tied to the task.
* @param description The description of the task.
* Constructor for a task with a specific logo.
* @param description The description of the task.
* @param logo The logo for the task.
* Returns icon representation of status of task.
* If done, return "X", otherwise a blank space.
* Marks task as done, and returns string representation of task being marked done.
* The isDone field of task is changed to true.
* @return string representation of task being marked done.
return String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  [X] %s", this.description);
* Logo is in a single alphabet form.
* @return string representation of logo of task.
* @return boolean representation of completion of task.
* The description is what user input at the start.
* @return string representation of description of task.
* String starts with a status icon followed by its description.
* Encapsulates a task that is a Todo.
* Similar to a task, a Todo has a description.
* @param description The description of the Todo.
* Returns string representation of a Todo task.
* Method override from toString() of parent class Task.
* Marks task as done, and returns string representation of Todo task being marked done.
* Method override from markDone() of parent class Task.
* @return string representation of Todo task being marked done.
return String.format("Nice! I've marked this task as done:\n  [T][X] %s", this.description);
* Encapsulates an exception meant for Duke.
* This class is extended from the Exception class,
* and has an additional attribute of a header
* that is used when printing error messages.
* @param message The message for the error to be constructed with.
* Returns the error message of the error.
* Overrides getMessage() of the Exception class,
* so that the messages have the header we want
* This class also contains methods that are
* related to the operations on the list of tasks.
* @param taskList The array of tasks to be initialized with.
* Adds a task to the taskList.
* @param task The task to be added.
* Deletes a task from the taskList.
* The index of the element is provided for deletion,
* and the deleted task is returned.
* @param index The index of the element to be deleted.
* and returns string representation of task being marked done.
* Task is marked based on index of task provided.
* @return string representation of event task being marked done.
* Returns the size of the TaskList.
* Returns the task in the taskList based on its index.
* @param index The index of the task to be returned.
* Encapsulates a parser to help make sense of user input.
* This class helps to split the command inputs of the user,
* for further usage by other classes.
/** Special names that are the commands for Duke */
* Returns a string array that contains the type of the command
* as its first element, and the remaining parts of the string
* @return The array of strings after splitting the input.
* Returns the index of the task.
* Parsed from an input that is already split based on type.
* @param typeInput The array of strings that is already split based on type.
* Checks whether task input has a valid description.
* @param typeInput The array of strings that is already split based on type.
* @param type The type of the task.
* @throws DukeException If description is empty or just a whitespace character.
public void checkDesc(String[] typeInput, String type) throws DukeException {
throw new DukeException("The description of " + type + " cannot be empty!");
* Returns an array of strings that is further split after being split by type.

* @param regex The regex to split the string at.
* @return The string that is split at the input regex.
public String[] furtherSplit(String input, String regex) {

throw new DukeException("The description of a " + type + " cannot be empty.\n" +
"Don't forget to use /by to indicate the deadline.");

* Encapsulates a storage to store the tasks of the user.
* This class helps with operations concerning the
* saving of new tasks and loading of old tasks from the hard disk.
* Saves current taskList into the hard disk.
* TaskList is saved as a .txt file.
* The filename of the file is stored in the attribute Filename of the class.
* @param taskList The taskList to be saved.
* Loads a previously stored taskList from the hard disk.
* The filename of the file is stored in the attribute Filename of the class.
* If the file does not exist, an empty taskList is instantiated and returned.
* @return The previously stored taskList, or if it is unavailable, an empty taskList.
System.out.println("Past tasks found. Use command \"list\" to list previous tasks.");
System.out.println("No past tasks found. Starting with a new list.");
* Encapsulates the Ui component of Duke.

+ "Im Duke\nWhat can I do for you?";

* Message is lined with the borders stored in the attribute of the class.
* @param message The message to be printed.
* @param taskList The taskList to be printed.
System.out.println("Here are the tasks in your list:");

* @param taskList The taskList which the tasks are added to.
